bug.author: bwegge
bug.description:
How to check if two lexemes are equal? I get the following behaviour, which I find odd: <denchmark-code>cat1 = nlp.vocab['cat']
cat2 = nlp.vocab['cat']
cat1 == cat2
False </denchmark-code>
I think cat1.orth == cat2.orth would work, but then one still cannot add Lexemes to sets, dicts, etc.

comments.comment: Thanks! Fixed. In the meantime you can do cat1.orth == cat2.orth

That was quick, many thanks! One more question regarding the fix: for isinstance(other, str), shouldn't it be a = self.orth_ (orth with underscore)? And how would string comparison match the statement in the test_lexeme_lt test case that says that '''More frequent is l.t. less frequent'''?
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
